intro: Fridericia pubescens, commonly known as the woolly fridericia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. Its small, pale yellow flowers are typically clustered in racemes, and it produces capsules as its fruit. Fridericia pubescens is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
